title: What does interdisciplinary mean in education? - Quora

response.answer_text: It means that the English department and science department developed a program that shows how science and English work together in the real world. In other words, you can't do chemistry without knowing the vocabulary or special English words used by that discipline. You can be a renowned chemist who wins the Novel Prize without the ability to communicate in English exactly what one has discovered in clear, concise English. That's “inter” which means ‘between’ and “displinary” which means 'of disciplines'.
